title: Sonja and the Bull (2012)
overview: Sonja and the Bull: Sonja, a city girl from Zagreb, a vegetarian and a hardcore animal-rights activist, strongly opposes bullfighting in Dalmatinska zagora (Dalmatian Hinterland). People find this irritating and they conclude that no matter how passionately Sonja loves animals, she would never dare to stand in front of a bull. Bets are raised and Sonja faces a challenge in the form of Ante, known far and wide for his powers of persuasion…
storyline: A comedy about two people with different world-views, from different places, whose fate, with the help from a bull Garonja (a name given to the black bulls in villages of Croatia), intertwine. Ante (Goran Bogdan) is a peasant from Dalmatian hinterland, a son of an bull fights organizer, and skilled insurance salesman. He is known by his powers of persuasion. At the voting for the Law for animal protection, biggest controversy is considering bull fights. Sonja (Judita Frankovic) is from Zagreb, an inveterate activist fighting for animal rights. In Dalmatian hinterland nobody can understand her attitude. They conclude that Sonja, regardless of the declared intense love of animals, would not dare stand in front of a bull. plot:
Animal rights activist Sonja (Judita Franković) and insurance broker Ante (Goran Bogdan) come from very different backgrounds.

Sonja speaks against bullfighting on TV, which angers some families in Ante's village, which has a tradition of bullfighting.

Stipe (Dejan Aćimović) bets that Sonja will not dare to come close to Garonje, his beloved bull. Ante is sent to Zagreb to bring Sonja to the village. Using his persuasive talents he succeeds. When the moment comes to face the bull Sonja shows a lot of courage.
